title: India's Champions Trophy Squad: BCCI Eyeing Star Who's Been Out Of Action For 417 Days, Jasprit Bumr.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
India's Champions Trophy Squad: BCCI Eyeing Star Who's Been Out Of Action For 417 Days, Jasprit Bumrah Uncertain

Publication Date: November 2, 2023 Source: NDTV

The announcement for the Champions Trophy squad is set for January 12, ahead of the tournament starting on February 19, 2024. This article discusses the uncertain status of star players like Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami, who is eyeing a return after a lengthy absence.

  • Champions Trophy starts on February 19, 2024, with India's first match on February 20.
  • Mohammed Shami, absent for 417 days since November 19, 2023, is expected to return after ankle surgery and complications.
  • Shami's fitness is being monitored by the BCCI, with a clearance required from the NCA.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's participation is uncertain due to a back injury sustained during the fifth Test against Australia.
  • Michael Clarke praised Bumrah as possibly the greatest all-format fast bowler ever.
"I know a lot of great fast bowlers, Curtly Ambrose, Glenn McGrath, didn't get to play T20 cricket, so I'm not talking about those guys, but in regards to anyone who has played all three formats, I think he might be the best ever." - Michael Clarke

This discussion highlights the potential make-up of India's squad for the prestigious tournament, emphasizing the importance of player fitness and selections.
newTitle: India's Champions Trophy Squad: BCCI Eyeing Star Who's Been Out Of Action For 417 Days, Jasprit Bumrah Uncertain

title: Amid concerns, WHO official says HMPV virus 'expected during winter' - Business Standard
summary:
WHO Addresses HMPV Virus Concerns Ahead of Winter

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Business Standard

Amid concerns surrounding the Human metapneumovirus (HMPV), WHO official Margaret Harris indicated that the rise in common respiratory infections is expected during winter and spring.

  • Margaret Harris reported a rise in respiratory infections in China, describing it as typical for the winter season.
  • Common pathogens include influenza, respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), HMPV, and SARS-CoV-2.
  • China's reported levels of respiratory infections are within the normal range for this season.
  • The test positivity rate for seasonal influenza was over 30% among patients with flu-like symptoms by the end of December.
  • Precautionary measures to avoid infection are similar to those used during the Covid-19 pandemic.
“According to the Chinese CDC data, the pathogens causing these infections are known ones.” - Margaret Harris

In conclusion, the rise in respiratory infections is normal for this time of year, and precautions remain essential to avoid illness.
newTitle: WHO Addresses HMPV Virus Concerns Ahead of Winter

summary:
Los Angeles Wildfires: 5 Dead as Firefighters Fight Uncontrolled Blazes

Publication Date: January 18, 2023 | Source: Hindustan Times

The wildfires in the Los Angeles area have claimed five lives and continue to spread, affecting tens of thousands of residents who have been forced to evacuate due to the uncontrolled blazes.

  • The wildfires have burned over 15,000 acres of land.
  • A state of emergency has been declared in Los Angeles.
  • Several schools, residences, and notable structures have been damaged or destroyed.
  • Power outages have impacted more than 1.5 million residents.
  • Film productions and events have been canceled due to hazardous conditions.
“We are prioritizing life over everything else,” said LA County Sheriff Robert G Luna.

The situation remains critical as firefighters face high winds and the flames continue to threaten communities.

At least 19 people have died following a brutal assault by gunmen on the presidential complex in Chad.

"This is a tragic incident that highlights the ongoing security challenges in the region." - An unnamed security official.

The incident underscores the continuing instability in Chad, which has faced violence stemming from various conflicts.

Antony Blinken rejects a Donald Trump Greenland grab as ‘not going to happen’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Antony Blinken rejects a Donald Trump Greenland grab as ‘not going to happen’

Date: Jan 09, 2025 03:57 AM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

In a clear stance against President-elect Donald Trump's aggressive rhetoric, Secretary of State Antony Blinken stated that a US takeover of Greenland is not a viable option.

  • Blinken criticized Trump's statement about acquiring Greenland, emphasizing that it's not going to happen.
  • Trump mentioned he would consider military action for economic security, including seizing Greenland.
  • Blinken highlighted Biden's administration's focus on strengthening alliances rather than alienating them.
  • Reports suggest that Biden's team is preparing the incoming administration for global engagement.
  • Blinken alluded to diplomatic efforts in the Middle East and Ukraine that set a positive groundwork for the future.
“The idea expressed about Greenland is obviously not a good one, but maybe more important: it’s obviously one that’s not going to happen.” - Antony Blinken

In conclusion, Blinken's remarks highlight a shift towards collaborative foreign policy, reinforcing the commitment to international alliances under the Biden administration.
newTitle: Antony Blinken firmly rejects Trump's Greenland proposal

title: Ahead of Maha Kumbh, race against time as tent city rises along Ganga - The Indian Express
summary:
Ahead of Maha Kumbh, race against time as tent city rises along Ganga

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The Maha Kumbh, described as the largest gathering of humanity on Earth, is set to take place in Prayagraj, with millions of pilgrims expected.

  • The event will begin on January 13, with an expected turnout of 40 crore devotees.
  • Preparation involves creating a temporary city along the Ganga, including roads, toilets, and pontoon bridges.
  • Significant delays were caused by the Ganga’s reluctance to recede, affecting the timeline for setup.
  • The Uttar Pradesh government has allocated an estimated budget of nearly Rs 7,000 crore for the event.
“The largest gathering of humanity on Earth”

This event showcases the extensive preparations required to accommodate millions of visitors, reflecting both the cultural significance and logistical challenges inherent in such a monumental gathering.
newTitle: Race Against Time as Tent City Rises Along the Ganga for Maha Kumbh

summary:
6 killed, 30 injured in stampede in queue for event tokens at Tirupati temple

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

A tragic stampede occurred at the Tirupati temple, resulting in the deaths of six individuals and injuries to thirty others while they were queuing for event tokens.

  • The stampede took place at a popular religious event.
  • Authorities reported chaos as the crowd surged unexpectedly.
  • Emergency services were quickly deployed to assist the injured.
  • This incident highlights concerns over crowd control at large public events.
“We are devastated by this tragic incident and are taking steps to ensure such events are managed better in the future.” - Official Statement

The incident underscores the importance of effective crowd management at popular religious sites to prevent such tragedies in the future.

title: ‘Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4’: What Dr V Narayanan Said After Becoming New ISRO Chief - News18
summary:
Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4: What Dr V Narayanan Said After Becoming New ISRO Chief

Date: January 08, 2025 | Source: News18

Rocket Scientist Dr V Narayanan, recently appointed as the chief of ISRO, aims to leverage technology for enhancing the lives of Indians. His vision includes ambitious space missions such as Chandrayaan-4, Gaganyan, and Venus orbital missions.

  • Dr Narayanan emphasizes the importance of his new role, describing it as a “great responsibility.”
  • He expressed confidence in India’s upcoming space missions during an interview with CNN-News18.
  • Narayanan will officially take charge on January 14.
  • He has nearly four decades of experience in ISRO and holds a strong belief in teamwork.
  • His wife and daughter expressed immense pride in his new position.
“Basically, the country needs a lot of things in terms of climate studies, disaster management system, communication requirements, satellites for communication, and earth observation.” - Dr V Narayanan

Dr Narayanan's leadership is expected to continue pushing ISRO towards innovative solutions that benefit society, emphasizing quality of life for Indian citizens.
newTitle: Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4: Insights from New ISRO Chief Dr V Narayanan

Pritish Nandy passes away at 73: Anil Kapoor, Kareena Kapoor Khan, Hansal Mehta and other celebs mourn hi - TOI Etimes
summary:
Pritish Nandy passes away at 73: Anil Kapoor, Kareena Kapoor Khan, Hansal Mehta and other celebs mourn his loss

Date: Wednesday Source: India Today

Pritish Nandy, a veteran poet, writer, filmmaker, and former parliamentarian, passed away at the age of 73. His death has prompted heartfelt tributes from many celebrities in the industry.

  • His son, Kushan Nandy, confirmed the news.
  • Tributes poured in from Anil Kapoor, Anupam Kher, Ranvir Shorey, and others, expressing their sorrow.
  • Anupam Kher referred to Nandy as his support system during his early career.
  • Anil Kapoor praised him as a fearless editor and a man of integrity.
  • Kareena Kapoor Khan shared memories from their collaboration on the film Chameli.
  • Filmmaker Hansal Mehta acknowledged Nandy's support in his journey as a filmmaker.
“He was my support system in my initial days in Mumbai.” – Anupam Kher
“Shocked and heartbroken by the loss of my dear friend Pritish Nandy.” – Anil Kapoor

Pritish Nandy left an indelible mark on Indian cinema, founding Pritish Nandy Communications and producing several acclaimed films like Pyaar Ke Side Effects and Jhankaar Beats. His contributions to the film industry and journalism will be remembered.
newTitle: Pritish Nandy passes away at 73: Celebrities mourn his loss

title: NASA astronauts stuck on International Space Station say they 'don't feel like castaways' - Sky News
summary:
NASA astronauts stuck on International Space Station say they 'don't feel like castaways'

Publication Date: August 24, 2024 | Source: Sky News

Two NASA astronauts, Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, have been aboard the International Space Station (ISS) since June 2024, facing unexpected delays in their return due to issues with their spacecraft. They express positivity about their stay and continue to complete important tasks in space.

  • The astronauts were initially scheduled for an eight-day mission but got stranded due to Boeing Starliner issues.
  • Speaking during a live video call, they emphasized they feel supported and engaged, contrary to feeling abandoned.
  • They are awaiting the arrival of NASA's next crew to return to Earth.
  • Despite not being able to observe wildfires in California from orbit, they plan to assist by taking pictures when possible.
  • They have effectively adapted to their extended stay, taking on regular ISS tasks and participating in upcoming spacewalks.
“Eventually we wanna go home, but we have a lot to do up here,” said Williams.

In conclusion, while the astronauts’ extended stay is unprecedented, their positive outlook and ongoing work on the ISS reflect their commitment to their mission and well-being.
newTitle: NASA Astronauts Stuck on ISS Feel Positive Despite Delays

title: A glass of milk every day can slash bowel cancer risk by fifth - The Times of India
Daily glass of milk may cut bowel cancer risk by fifth, research finds - The Guardian
summary:
Daily Glass of Milk May Cut Bowel Cancer Risk by Fifth, Research Finds

Publication Date: December 12, 2024 Source: The Guardian

Research shows that drinking a large glass of milk daily could lower the risk of bowel cancer by nearly 20%. The study indicates that calcium, whether from dairy or non-dairy sources, is the key protective factor against the disease.

  • A daily intake of 300mg of calcium is linked to a 17% reduced risk of bowel cancer.
  • Calcium from both dairy and fortified soy milk has similar positive effects.
  • Bowel cancer is the third most common cancer globally, with increasing cases among younger populations.
  • The study analyzed dietary data from over 540,000 women over 17 years.
  • Increases in alcohol and red or processed meat consumption are associated with higher bowel cancer risks.
“This comprehensive study provides robust evidence that dairy products may help prevent colorectal cancer, largely due to the calcium they contain,” said Dr. Keren Papier, study author.

In conclusion, maintaining a healthy diet rich in calcium and low in alcohol and red meats can significantly lower bowel cancer risks.
newTitle: Daily Glass of Milk May Reduce Bowel Cancer Risk by 17%

Why Is Maha Kumbh Important? Significance Of A 'Deity's Folly' Amid Return Of Festivities After 144 Years - News18
summary:
Why Is Maha Kumbh Important? Significance Of A 'Deity's Folly' Amid Return Of Festivities After 144 Years

Date: January 08, 2025, Source: News18

The Maha Kumbh Mela is a significant Hindu festival being organized after 144 years in Prayagraj, starting January 13, 2025. Its importance lies in its historical, spiritual, and cultural significance for millions.

  • It is one of the largest religious gatherings globally, attracting millions of devotees.
  • Hindu mythology associates it with the churning of the ocean of milk and the quest for nectar, or amrita.
  • The festival lasts until February 26, 2025, and is expected to draw 40 to 45 crore devotees.
  • Numerous ceremonies, including 'Shahi Snaan' (Royal Bath), are part of the festivities.
🚨 #BREAKING :1100 priests in Maha Kumbh Mela will perform ‘Maha Yagya’ to demand the status of ‘Rashtra Mata’ for Cow. Here’s the Drone visuals of the largest ‘Yagya Kund’ of Maha Kumbh Mela. MESMERIZING 💖

The Maha Kumbh Mela serves as both a religious gathering and a cultural event, reinforcing faith and community among participants.
newTitle: Why Is Maha Kumbh Important? Significance Of A 'Deity's Folly' Amid Return Of Festivities After 144 Years

title: Woman Alleges Assault By Kuki "Tenants" Over Land, Naga Village Authority In Manipur Sends Warning - NDTV
summary:
Woman Alleges Assault By Kuki "Tenants" Over Land, Naga Village Authority In Manipur Sends Warning

Publication Date: January 25, 2025

Source: NDTV

A village authority in Manipur has condemned an alleged attack by Kuki tribesmen on a woman who was attempting to build a house on disputed land, highlighting escalating tensions between the Naga and Kuki communities.

  • The Konsakhul Village Authority has given a 15-day ultimatum for the Kuki tenants to vacate the land claimed by the Naga villagers.
  • A woman was reportedly assaulted by 30 men from the Kuki tribes while trying to build a home, prompting civil society organizations to intervene.
  • Video evidence emerged showing aggressive behavior towards the Naga villagers by Kuki individuals.
  • Indigenous People's Forum has demanded immediate action for the safety of Naga villagers, launching a blockade at a key thoroughfare.
  • This incident comes amid growing tensions and previous allegations of violence involving Kuki volunteers against Naga tribes in the region.
“I am the person who was assaulted... The Kukis said I can't build a house there. Some 10-20 of them came, attacked me.” - The woman who was allegedly assaulted.

This incident highlights the ongoing land disputes and ethnic tensions in Manipur, necessitating urgent dialogue and resolution to prevent further violence.
newTitle: Woman Alleges Assault by Kuki Tribes Over Land Dispute in Manipur

title: Astronaut set to patch NASA's X-ray telescope aboard space station - Phys.org
Gold googly bamboozles import data - The Hindu
summary:
Gold Imports Cause Major Revision in India's Import Data

Published: January 08, 2025 11:23 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

India's import bill for November 2024 has undergone a significant $6 billion revision, largely due to lower than expected gold imports which have raised concerns among economists about the accuracy of trade data.

  • India's import bill revised from $70 billion to $63.86 billion for November 2024.
  • $5 billion downward revision attributed to gold imports, which were revised to $37.4 billion from $49.1 billion.
  • This change reflects a dramatic shift, marking a mere 13.5% rise compared to the previous year instead of a 49% spike.
  • Overall cumulative import figure for 2024-25 dropped to $472.5 billion, a decrease of nearly 3%.
  • Trade deficit for November revised down to around $31.8 billion from the earlier $37.84 billion estimate.
“The government must explain the rationale behind the revision to ensure India’s economic data retains credibility among investors and financial markets.” - Ajai Srivastava

This substantial revision in India's trade data raises questions about the reliability of economic indicators and highlights the importance of transparent reporting.
newTitle: Gold Imports Cause Major Revision in India's import Data
